name: market for calcium borates | calcium borates | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2521/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'calcium borates', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;'calcium borates'  are inorganic substances, represented by the substance with a CAS no. : 12007-56-6. It is called 'calcium borate' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: Ca3B2O6. It is solid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure. It is modelled as a pure substance.  On a consumer level, is used in the following products: soap and detergents. On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: waste treatment, polymers, glass and agriculture.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'calcium borates',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'calcium borates',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

exchanges.description:
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions of transport by rail and inland waterways.
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.
